intro: Cryptantha cedrosensis, commonly known as Cedros Island flax. It is a flowering plant native to the Channel Islands of California, specifically Santa Cruz Island. This species belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in coastal scrub habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Cryptantha cedrosensis is considered a rare and endemic species, making it a significant subject of botanical study.
